title: Types of Sampling: Self-Defense
question_text:
A large company wants to conduct a survey to determine the proportion of its female employees who practice self-defense on a daily basis. $4$ of its regional offices are randomly selected and all of the women in those offices are surveyed.
This plan is an example of which type of sampling?
solution:
In this sampling plan, we are randomly selecting four of the regional offices and selecting all the women in those offices. This type of plan is a cluster sample, so Choice 'B' is our answer.

A more formal definition of a cluster sample is when the population is divided into smaller groups. These groups should reflect the population. Then choose a simple random sample of these groups all and choose all the subjects within those groups.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect as a convenience sample is choosing individuals who are easiest to reach (for instance, choosing the first $50$ women the company contacts).

Choice 'C' is incorrect as a stratified sample would have been if we selected all the regional offices and then randomly selected a group of individuals from each office.

Choice 'D' is incorrect as a simple random sample is a sample in which every group of size n individuals have an equal chance to be chosen. This is not an SRS because not every group of size n has an equal chance of being chosen since some of the regional offices are being left out.

If this were a simple random sample, then a possibility would be having women from all the regional offices involved in the survey. In this case, we are limited to $4$ of the regional offices.

Choice 'E' is incorrect as a systematic sample is one in which every kth element is selected. For example, if the women's names were ordered alphabetically and the large company surveyed every third woman).
